fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Let T \colon \mathcal { C } ^ \mathrm {op} \to \mathsf { CAT } be a doctrine. Suppose that for each morphism f \colon X \to Y in \mathcal { C }, f ^{*} admits a left adjoint \Sigma _{f}. Then T is said to satisfy Beck-Chevalley condition if, whenever there is a pullback shown below, we have f ^{*} \Sigma _{g} \cong \Sigma _{h} k ^{*}.

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Furthermore, if for each morphism f \colon X \to Y in \mathcal { C }, f ^{*} admits a right adjoint \Pi _{f}. Then this condition implies that f ^{*} \Pi _{g} \cong \Pi _{h} k ^{*} by the uniqueness of adjoint.

Let \mathcal { C } be a category with finite products. A (primitive) doctrine over \mathcal { C } is a \mathcal { C }-indexed category T \colon \mathcal { C } ^ \mathrm {op} \to \mathsf { CAT }. If T \colon \mathcal { C } ^ \mathrm {op} \to \mathsf { CAT } and U \colon \mathcal { D } ^ \mathrm {op} \to \mathsf { CAT } are primitive doctrines, then a morphism of doctrines F \colon T \to U consists of the following data:

fr:ul.fr:li: A finite-product preserving functor F_{0} \colon \mathcal { C } \to \mathcal { D }.
For each object X \in \mathcal { C }, a functor F_{1,X} \colon TX \to UF_{0}X.

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: These data are subject to the condition that for any morphism f \colon X \to Y in \mathcal { C }, the following square commutes:

fr:embedded-tex.fr:embedded-tex-body: \DiagramSquare { nw = TY, ne = {UF_{0}Y}, sw = TX, se = {UF_{0}X}, north = {F_{1,Y}}, south = {F_{1,X}}, west = {Tf}, east = {UF_{0}f}, }

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: A (first-order) hyperdoctrine is a doctrine T \colon \mathcal { C } ^ \mathrm {op} \to \mathsf { CAT } satisfying the following additional conditions:

fr:ul.fr:li: For each object X \in \mathcal { C }, the fiber T(X) is cartesian closed and has finite coproducts.
For each morphism f \colon X \to Y in \mathcal { C }, f ^{*} admits both a left adjoint \Sigma _{f} and a right adjoint \Pi _{f}.

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: A morphism between hyperdoctrines F \colon T \to U is a morphisms between doctrines satisfying the additional condition that for each morphism f \colon X \to Y in \mathcal { C }, the following squares commute:

fr:embedded-tex.fr:embedded-tex-body: \DiagramSquare { nw = TX, ne = {UF_{0}X}, sw = TY, se = {UF_{0}Y}, north = {F_{1,X}}, south = {F_{1,Y}}, west = { \Sigma _{f}}, east = { \Sigma _{F_{0}f}}, } \qquad \DiagramSquare { nw = TX, ne = {UF_{0}X}, sw = TY, se = {UF_{0}Y}, north = {F_{1,X}}, south = {F_{1,Y}}, west = { \Pi _{f}}, east = { \Pi _{F_{0}f}}, }

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Verify that the isomorphisms constructed in the second half are natural.

Moreover, for each morphism f \colon X \to Y in \mathcal { C }, the following square commutes up to isomorphism.

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Let \mathcal { C } be a category with finite limits. A regular hyperdoctrine T \colon \mathcal { C } ^ \mathrm {op} \to \mathsf { CAT } (or elementary existential doctrine) is a doctrine satisfying the following conditions:

fr:ul.fr:li: For each object X \in \mathcal { C }, the fiber T(X) has finite limits.
For each morphism f \colon X \to Y in \mathcal { C }, f ^{*} admits a left adjoint \Sigma _{f}.
Each left adjoint \Sigma _{f} satisfies the Beck-Chevalley condition.

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Subobject doctrine of a regular category

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Let \mathcal { C } be a regular category, then the subobject doctrine \mathsf { Sub } \colon \mathcal { C } ^ \mathrm {op} \to \mathsf { CAT } is a regular hyperdoctrine with comprehension schema.

First, each fiber \mathsf { Sub } (A) has finite limits inherited from \mathcal { C }. By , each f ^{*} has the required left adjoint \exists _{f}. They satisfy the Beck-Chevalley condition because images commute with pullbacks in a regular category. Then the naming functor { \mathopen {}[ \mathord { \hspace {1pt} \text {--} \hspace {1pt}} ] \mathclose {}} _{X} \colon { \mathcal { C } _{/{ X }}} \to \mathsf { Sub } (X) is precisely the image \mathsf { Img }, which admits the inclusion functor as a right adjoint.
